psalm.text:
[[Ps 19,8]]The law of the LORD is perfect, 
refreshing the soul; 
The decree of the LORD is trustworthy, 
giving wisdom to the simple.

[[Ps 19,9]]The precepts of the LORD are right,
rejoicing the heart; 
The command of the LORD is clear, 
enlightening the eye.  

[[Ps 19,10]]The fear of the LORD is pure, 
enduring forever; 
The ordinances of the LORD are true, 
all of them just.

[[Ps 19,11]]They are more precious than gold, 
Than a heap of purest gold; 
Sweeter also than syrup 
Or honey from the comb.

gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Mark
gospel.text:
[[Mc 11,27]]Jesus and his disciples returned once more to Jerusalem. As he was walking in the temple area, the chief priests, the scribes, and the elders approached him
[[Mc 11,28]]and said to him, "By what authority are you doing these things? Or who gave you this authority to do them?"
[[Mc 11,29]]Jesus said to them, "I shall ask you one question. Answer me, and I will tell you by what authority I do these things.
[[Mc 11,30]]Was John's baptism of heavenly or of human origin? Answer me."
[[Mc 11,31]]They discussed this among themselves and said, "If we say, 'Of heavenly origin,' he will say, '(Then) why did you not believe him?'
[[Mc 11,32]]But shall we say, 'Of human origin'?"--they feared the crowd, for they all thought John really was a prophet.
[[Mc 11,33]]So they said to Jesus in reply, "We do not know." Then Jesus said to them, "Neither shall I tell you by what authority I do these things."

first_reading.title: Book of Sirach
first_reading.text:
[[Si 51,12c]]I thank the Lord and I praise him;
[[Si 51,12d]]I bless the name of the LORD.
[[Si 51,13]]When I was young and innocent, I sought wisdom.
[[Si 51,14]]She came to me in her beauty, and until the end I will cultivate her.
[[Si 51,15]]As the blossoms yielded to ripening grapes, the heart's joy, My feet kept to the level path because from earliest youth I was familiar with her.
[[Si 51,16]]In the short time I paid heed, I met with great instruction.
[[Si 51,17]]Since in this way I have profited, I will give my teacher grateful praise.
[[Si 51,18]]I became resolutely devoted to her-- the good I persistently strove for.
[[Si 51,19]]I burned with desire for her, never turning back. I became preoccupied with her, never weary of extolling her. My hand opened her gate and I came to know her secrets.
[[Si 51,20]]For her I purified my hands; in cleanness I attained to her. At first acquaintance with her, I gained understanding such that I will never forsake her.
